results.description: Managerless Hibernian hammer St Johnstone with Christian Doidge netting a hat-trick. (UK only)

results.description: A Christian Doidge hat-trick inspires managerless Hibernian to just a second Scottish Premiership win of the season as they rout St Johnstone in Perth.
results.shortTitle: Doidge hat-trick powers Hibs to rout
results.title: St Johnstone 1-4 Hibernian: Christian Doidge hat-trick powers visitors to second league win

results.description: Tommy Wright says he is focusing on St Johnstone despite being linked with Northern Ireland as Michael O'Neill closes on a move to Stoke City.

results.title: St Johnstone's Tommy Wright coy over Northern Ireland link but says 'my CV is quite strong'

results.description: Watch the goal as St Johnstone beat Hearts 1-0 at McDiarmid Park in what proved to be Craig Levein's last match as manager.

results.description: Watch the goal as St Johnstone beat Hearts 1-0 at McDiarmid Park to leapfrog the Tynecastle side and move off the bottom of the Scottish Premiership.
results.title: Highlights: St Johnstone 1-0 Hearts

results.description: St Johnstone move off the foot of the Scottish Premiership table with a 1-0 win that heightens the pressure on Hearts manager Craig Levein.
results.shortTitle: St Johnstone eighth after beating Hearts
results.title: St Johnstone 1-0 Hearts: Own goal piles pressure on Craig Levein

results.description: St Johnstone manager Tommy Wright was delighted with his team's first Scottish Premiership win this season after defeating Hamilton 3-2.

results.description: St Johnstone's winless start to the Scottish Premiership season was finally halted with a dramatic 3-2 victory over Hamilton Academical.

results.description: St Johnstone's problems continue after they fall to a 2-0 defeat to St Mirren. (UK only)

results.description: St Johnstone manager Tommy Wright believes his current squad is the most talented he's ever assembled, but the players and his coaching are letting the Perth club down.

results.description: St Johnstone manager Tommy Wright says he and his players are "letting the club down" after they capitulated at St Mirren to continue their winless start to the Scottish Premiership season.
results.shortTitle: We are all letting club down - Wright
results.title: Tommy Wright: St Johnstone boss says he & players 'letting club down'
